es.csic.iiia.nsm.perception

Interface Sensor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommunityWatcher, TrafficCamera

    public interface Sensor
    A sensor that perceives the scenario
    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getId()
      Returns the id of the sensor
      java.lang.String getLocation()
      Gives a description about where the sensor is placed
      ViewTransition getPerception()
      Returns the last perception performed by the sensor, which consists of a ViewTransition that contains as many views as it was set in the perception window.
      void setPerceptionWindow(int ticks)
      Sets the number of time steps of the window.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        int getId()
        Returns the id of the sensor
        Returns:
        the id of the sensor

      • getLocation

        java.lang.String getLocation()
        Gives a description about where the sensor is placed
        Returns:
        the location of the sensor

      • setPerceptionWindow

        void setPerceptionWindow(int ticks)
        Sets the number of time steps of the window. For instance, for a window with t-2, t-1, t, you should set a perception window of 3 time steps
        Parameters:
        ticks - the number of time steps of the window

      • getPerception

        ViewTransition getPerception()
        Returns the last perception performed by the sensor, which consists of a ViewTransition that contains as many views as it was set in the perception window. For instance, a window of 3 time steps will perceive view streams of 3 views (one (for each time step)
        Returns:
        a ViewTransition that contains as many views as it was set in the perception window. For instance, a window of 3 time steps will perceive view streams of 3 views (one (for each time step)
